{"step_by_step_thinking": "Etanercept is a disease-modifying drug used in the management of rheumatoid arthritis. To determine its mechanism of action, we can review the relevant documents. Document [18] states that etanercept is a TNF inhibitor, which reduces the effect of naturally present TNF-alpha. This supports the conclusion that the mechanism of action of etanercept is inhibition of TNF alpha.", "answer_choice": "A"}
